summary.para: Get a pointer to a blend-state variable.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of blend-state descriptions. If there is only one blend-state variable in the effect, use 0.

param.name: pBlendDesc
param.para: A pointer to a blend-state description (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. Backing store data can used to recreate the variable when necessary.

summary.para: Get a pointer to a blend-state interface.

param.name: Index
param.para: Index into an array of blend-state interfaces. If there is only one blend-state interface, use 0.

param.name: ppBlendState
param.para: The address of a pointer to a blend-state interface (see ).

returns.para: Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: The blend-variable interface accesses blend state.

remarks.para: An ID3D10EffectBlendVariable Interface is created when an effect is read into memory.

Effect variables are saved in memory in the backing store; when a technique is applied, the values in the backing store are copied to the device. You can use either of these methods to return state. For examples, see Two Ways to Get the State in an Effect Variable.
